fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.auth

Interface ITicket


  • public interface ITicket
    Represents a local authentication ticket obtained from an authentication service. A ticket can be obtained using a user's principal and credentials or from an already-granted ticket token ID.

    A ticket can expire locally and be replaced with a new instance by revalidating the ticket's token, using IAuthnService.authenticate(String). Note that the expiry time can change dynamically (and become locally-expired even if the token is still valid in a remote session): local expiry may occur when optimizing local caches or when the OSGi-based authentication and directory services are updated at runtime.

    The authenticated user can be obtained from the ticket, unless the ticket has expired.

    Ticket tokens may be stored as serializable local session attributes. Full live instances of user objects and ticket objects must not be directly stored as local session attributes.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      IUser getAuthenticatedUser()
      Gets the authenticated user, unless the ticket has expired or has been invalidated.
      IAuthnService getAuthnService()
      Gets the authentication service that provided this ticket.
      long getTicketExpiryTime()
      Gets the expected ticket expiry time.
      String getTicketToken()
      Gets the serialized ticket token, which the connector will recognize for authentication without requiring retransmission of a user's principal and credentials.
      void invalidate()
      Invalidates this ticket instance.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthenticatedUser

        IUser getAuthenticatedUser()
                    throws TicketExpiryException,
                           TicketTokenException
        Gets the authenticated user, unless the ticket has expired or has been invalidated.
        Returns:
        the authenticated user, never null.
        Throws:
        TicketExpiryException - if the ticket has expired.
        TicketTokenException - if the ticket has been invalidated.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAuthnService

        IAuthnService getAuthnService()
        Gets the authentication service that provided this ticket.
        Returns:
        the authentication service, never null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTicketToken

        String getTicketToken()
        Gets the serialized ticket token, which the connector will recognize for authentication without requiring retransmission of a user's principal and credentials.
        Returns:
        the ticket token, never null (even if expired).
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTicketExpiryTime

        long getTicketExpiryTime()
        Gets the expected ticket expiry time.

        Note: this may change dynamically, based on server throughput and runtime service updates. It is generally shorter than the time to live for ticket tokens in a remote session managed by the connector.

        Returns:
        the expected ticket expiry time.
        Since:
        1.0

      • invalidate

        void invalidate()
         throws TicketTokenException
        Invalidates this ticket instance.

        Note: this will attempt to invalidate this local ticket instance and the remote server's ticket instance. It will not invalidate serialized ticket tokens: such ticket tokens may be locally restored, but will be rejected by the remote server when any operation is attempted requiring a valid ticket. Therefore, when invalidating ticket instances, you must delete all derived ticket tokens.

        Throws:
        TicketTokenException - if an error occurred invalidating the ticket (attempting to invalidate an already-invalidated ticket is not considered as an error).
        Since:
        1.0
